Just with one word said, it's TERRIBLE game. This game should be free, because is not even 1$ worth...

reviewText:
Did you like POVRAY graphics in the 90s? Then this game is for you!

The 'adventure puzzles' are ridiculous (90% of them involving a magic scroll to solve problems). The other puzzles are just dumbed down versions of ones you can find in better games (for example a match-the-shape one that's more suited for a three year old). It feels like a cheap hidden object game just without the hidden object scenes.

The graphics are basic 3D rendered scenes that feel absolutely lifeless. You can see on the screenshots that it's barely better than early 90s 3D rendered pictures. This wouldn't be a problem if the game was actually good and engaging, but it surely isn't.

The voice acting is decent and the cut scenes have at least some effort put into them. The story itself though is very generic and quite boring.

There's nothing in this 'game' that makes it worth playing. There are better free games out there. Much better games...
voteText: 27 of 32 people (84%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: It's not the best adventure game I've played, with  fairly straigtforward puzzles, most relying upon magical scolls to initiate.  solving  all of them is relatively easy.  Placing  things in order by color, sliding puzzles and jigsaw puzzles are the usual ones.  The graphic is  okay, the story  okay, the game play okay.  If you're into point and click, with an element of HOG, then this is  an 'okay' game.  For me it didn't quite  draw me in like  Myst, Blade Runner, Syberia, Grim Fandango, Monkey Island, Beneath a Steel Sky, Broken Sword and Disc World to name just a few.  I don't think i'll be looking back ten years hence thinking  this was a classic, but it is playable and mildly intresting so it deserves a thumbs up.

reviewText: Most puzzles lack any foreshadowing or logic.  You're just supposed to guess.  The badly rendered environments result in several pixel hunts.  At least one of the hints is blatantly wrong.  It's telling that the best parts of the game were the repeated stock sliding and jigsaw puzzles.\n\nPahelika: Secret Legends resembles something a small child would come up with if tasked to design an adventure game (EDIT: It looks like people found that insulting to small children; I apologize).  KISS Ltd has published some bad games, but accepting something like this is just shameful!  Spend your time and money on something that deserves it.
voteText: 15 of 27 people (56%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: The Graphics are okay, as is the sound. After stage 5 however, any reasoning behind the puzzles seem to disappear, and you'll make extensive use of the hint/skip button.\nThis would not be so bad if that button did not take ages to charge.\nStorywise, it's more of a prologue, and not really worth the 9 euros. Because of the puzzle issues and the price I'm giving it a negative review
